text: You never change things by fighting the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete.
Accidentally ran into purdue's swing club dancin' to live music TWO BLOCKS from my apt on the way home from work. It'll be a happy year.
Can anyone recommend a good mobile identi.ca client? (android or shell-based) My searches only turn up stuff for twitter.
@kfogel reminded me to check copyright policies for venues teaching open source submits to. I did. They're depressing. Help?
Soul renewal on a plate: local heirloom tomatoes & basil, fresh mozz, cracked pepper & olive oil on local whole-grain bread. I needed that.
Got assigned my Purdue grad student office -- engineering building, room 1337. #epicwin
@oscon suggestion for next year -- a nap room. Dim lights, put down gym mats, and we won't have to trek back to the hotel for lunch catnaps.
@harishpillay haven't found you at #oscon yet, but will - if nothing else, meet at #fedora booth lunch tomorrow and go in for food together?
@twleung - @nkkl suggested we meet up at #oscon. Lynn Stein ex-student, Red Hat engineer & community hacker, edu geek. Carnival today?
#oscon python tutorial flaking the rust off my coding fingers; unittests & type checking, long time no see!
@educomm sdz+my talk notes (including Q&A demos) from "Open Source Textbooks & Collaboration Workflows" at http://bit.ly/educomm-opensource
Chopping and freezing vegetables en masse == WIN. Tossed in a skillet with half a jar of seitan, it's instant cheap tasty lunch. Omnomnom!
The @beefymiracle Fedora Remix, available for download at http://beefymiracle.org - enjoy the installer art and icons! (YA RLY)
@posscon - http://bit.ly/curious-artifacts now has audience participation pics from our talk - with smileyface stickers.
Found our new contributor @posscon; thanks to Kevin E. who'll be joining our talk on "Curious Artifacts" tomorrow! http://bit.ly/fyhaTd
@sdziallas and I are looking for @posscon volunteers for our talk - first time FOSS contributor? Find me! http://bit.ly/fyhaTd
I just took the @AdaInitiative open technology and culture census. You should too! http://svy.mk/adacensus2011
Discussing differences between http://www.gnu.org/philosophy/free-sw.html and http://www.opensource.org/osd.html at #possesa
Teaching at #possesa with @ppapadeas and @jwildeboer, http://bit.ly/POSSE-SA-2010
@dkeats doing http://bit.ly/posseworkshop in Cape Town 1st week Oct, @paulscott56 thought you might be interested in coming/visiting. email?
@paulscott56 ok! it's 10/4 morning - 10/8 lunch, big dinner 10/7, drop by anytime. easier to coordinate on email? mel at redhat dot com.
@paulscott56 - doing http://bit.ly/posseworkshop in Cape Town 1st week Oct and was told to ping you re nearby FOSS folks visiting, interest?
In China next week to work on #fedorazh with @gbraad - what's highest-priority for local Ambassadors? (Any good hashtags for 中文 dents?)
@lhawthorn: sure, 9:30 works. See you at Denny's, where I will likely have the huevos rancheros at last. ;)
@lh @rbergeron Denny's at 9am! Yes! Nth time's the charm. (Sorry, Leslie - I couldn't figure out where people were this morning...)
#oscon talk on different types of diversity: interests, skillsets, perspectives - more useful breakdown than gender/age/race/etc imo.
To track audience participation in the talk @quaid and I are about to give at #oscon, use #5edu - you'll be on the big screen.
@lh ok - we're not burgerville fans, but +1 to the "catch later today."
@lh lunch? whereabouts are you?
@nickelpic, @bibliothomas if I have you to thank for ASL today - THANK YOU! (also hard of hearing, usually just struggle to lipread)
@jwildeboer: parking lot, 10pm tonight. the 1st rule of violent communication session is that you microblog violent communication session ;)
Just got a gwibber/microblogging crash-course from @quaid at #cls. Another thing to be distracted by!
@bibliothomas I'm interested, are you doing a nonviolent comms session at #cls this afternoon?
@lh Will you be in PDX next week during OSCON? I'd love to catch up! There's a Teaching Open Source BoF  … http://identi.ca/notice/41164735
Ah, but "LOSSE" is a bit less catchy. ;-) Joe, if we run a European POSSE in the fall, maybe we can get you over there. http://post.ly/WWyw
opensource.com/education - "Moodle: Open source, closed doors." http://bit.ly/dDbeOm
tweeting about posse with profs teaching open source here: @posse2009
http://twitpic.com/8yuyf - #necc09 bingo - add buzzwords and make your own!
I'm having a hard time finding #necc09 sessions that aren't "talk at you" presentations right now - where is interactivity?
a young engineer's notes continued: #necc09 monday notes, parts 1 and 2: http://tinyurl.com/necc09mon and http://tinyurl.com/necc09mon2
#necc09 and a thank you to my teachers from the last 17 years. http://bit.ly/CYNk7
#necc09 sunday notes finally up, from a young engineer's pov: http://tinyurl.com/necc09sun
watching teachers blog/tweet circles around me + big laptop has convinced me I should invest in a smartphone or netbook, any recs? #necc09
@quaid #necc09 is rockin'; need to get netbook or smartphone so I can actually haul backchannel with me.
From last week: does user-filtering marginalize alt. views? Getting Kenya stories regardless of your interests may not be a bad thing. #iif
Sorry about the #iif pizza delay, folks. Will mail epic story to list. Pizza has pooled in the back if you're still hungry.
@Conor_Kennedy #iif something like the http://pandora.com model, or how students get access to subscriptions through their uni library?
@ellenchisa http://tinyurl.com/dxereg
#iif what groups would an open-law policy be disadvantageous to, other than businesses dependent on IP?
@debbierosenbaum hey, the joelfightsback feed mentions you need coders... what are you looking for?
@danray #iif it was a real event, involving stallman, emacs, and the gpl. http://www.free-soft.org/gpl_history/
@GwenHochman: #iif maybe it needed to be explicitly stated legally to cause people to switch to the sharing paradigm? (rather than abuse)
@megerman #iif see http://tinyurl.com/2tzxvx by our guest :)

@GrenHochman #iif creator, proprietary: lose an opportunity for $
creators, FOSS: want other contributors more than consumers, don't care?
@GwenHochman #iif  if a consumer uses a competitor's product: other consumers (proprietary/FOSS): don't care, they're using what they want
@davealevine #iif look at p. 32 of Lerner re: free sw leadership - it's by example/influence, rather than assigned authority
@vranieri: #iif - maybe. but free sw devs are also adding features they want to sw they use. public defenders may be less selfish. :)
#iif what do people think of http://tinyurl.com/czpox5's comparison to academics?
#iif laptop stickers: not just coders. http://www.flickr.com/photos/jaxuk/266135976/
#iif @gwbstr - *looks* all of mako's stickers are free sw ones, so are all but one of mine, can't see others
@debbierosenbaum #iif maybe some artists feel they need copyright to preserve the value of their work, and some coders feel the same re: OSS
#iif I was told in (engineering) college to license my class projects as free software for portfolio goodness, but Olin is weird.
#iif @gwbstr - people get paid to make free software, and use it as a way to build portfolios for jobapps too.
I give up on ReadyTalk. I'm using the phone.
Bluh. Still can't ReadyTalk, even with direct route. (Firefox in ubuntu)
Having trouble getting to the slides in Firefox still... wish there was an irc backchannel instead - faster than twitter.
